steps.title: Preview documents
Git configuration
steps.description:
To contribute to documentation in [GitHub](https://github.com/TRUBA-HPC/Belgeler), you need to configure `user.name` and `user.email`. Toggle integrated terminal by hitting F1 and typing [View: toggle terminal](command:workbench.action.terminal.toggleTerminal). Type into terminal:

```
git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email youremail@address.com
```

Note: Make sure your email address matches your GitHub account email address.

You can list global Git configuration using:

```git config --list```

steps.title: Download changes
steps.description:
Before making any changes, it is good to download the most recent changes from the remote git repository. Type into terminal:

>> git pull origin main

steps.title: Fork repository
steps.description: It would be best to fork the [GitHub repo](https://github.com/TRUBA-HPC/Belgeler) by clicking the Fork button on the top right corner. By default, users can only push changes to forked repositories on their accounts.

steps.title: Create new branch
steps.description:
The [eventual workflow](https://docs.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request) will look like the following: Create a new branch → Make changes to the documentation → Save changes → Push changes to remote branch → Create a pull request to propose changes to the repository. Create a new branch by typing:

```
git checkout -b [name-of-your-new-branch]
```

steps.title: Save changes
steps.description:
After making changes to documentation, [save your changes](https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/saving-changes) using:
```
git add --all
git commit -m "info about this commit"
```

steps.title: Create GitHub personal access token
steps.description: In the next step, when you use Git to authenticate with GitHub, you'll be prompted to enter your credentials to authenticate with GitHub. Password-based authentication is [deprecated](https://docs.github.com/en/github/authenticating-to-github/about-authentication-to-github#authenticating-with-the-command-line), so you should create a personal access token, which is more secure. To create a personal access token, you can follow this [guide](https://docs.github.com/en/github/authenticating-to-github/creating-a-personal-access-token). Setting the scope to **repo** is enough.

steps.title: Add new origin
steps.description:
To push changes to the forked repo on your account, we need to add a new remote. Check remotes using:

```git remote -v```

Add new remote pointing to the forked repo:

 ```git remote add myRemote https://github.com/[USERNAME]/Belgeler```

Note: Change ```[USERNAME]``` in the command above.

steps.title: Push changes and create a pull request
steps.description:
After committing all changes, check if you committed all changes. Also get the `[name-of-your-branch]`

>> git status

Push to remote branch:

```
git push myRemote [name-of-your-branch]
```
To create a pull request, go to the [repository (pull requests)](https://github.com/[USERNAME]/Belgeler/pulls), click new pull request, and select the branch you just pushed. Congratulations, you just created a new pull request! ðŸŽ‰

Sphinx is a documentation generator that translates a set of plain text source files into various output formats (e.g.; html and pdf). You can use this [reference](https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/restructuredtext/index.html) while writing docs using reStructuredText.
